intro: Cinchona conglomerata, commonly known as the Andean quinine tree, is a species native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and fragrant, white flowers. The plant is notable for its production of alkaloids, including quinine, which has historically been used in medicine. Its botanical features include simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered fruits that contain seeds. Cinchona conglomerata thrives in humid, cool climates and is often found in cloud forests.
